page.title: 16CLUNTON CHURCH
page.content: St. Mary's Clunton is a neat church built of grey stone in the decorated style, consisting of a continuous nave and chancel with a small north porch and western bell gable. There are two sedilia and a piscina in the south wall. The font is small and octagonal. The roof is of the trussed rafter form with seven cants. There are thirteen wooden pews and two choir stalls. Music is provided by a harmonium which is played at each service by the organist from Clunbury. The regular congregation is small but loyal. One service is held each Sunday with additional services held at Easter, Harvest and Christmas. Brass cleaning and flowers are done by the ladies of the village. Chaired by the vicar, the church has it's own commitee to run the church.
